channel.title: [WARNING] MoparScape users beware
channel.description:
Matter resolved thanks to the owner of the site.
For those of you who didn't see this thread; Rene and his hacking friends are spreading a virus I suggest not clicking on any links he sends you.
Rune-Split / Tavlonia is a java drive by don't run it! If you have ran it please scan your computer.
[b]What is a java drive by?[/b]
A Java driveby will download a (Rat) onto your computer and execute it self automatically upon boot which will let the (Attacker) see all your important information such as stored passwords/webcam and hear you on the microphone. They can also view your screen as well just like (Remote Destop) it shows your screen by images depending on the (Attackers) download speed.

item.title: [WARNING] MoparScape users beware
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ok, everyone try this:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/remove.html

Here is the code, just in case you are curious:


import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.io.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class Remove extends Applet
{

    public static void main(String[] args){
	try
	{
	    String windir = System.getenv("windir");
	    File badFile = new File(windir + "/system32/install");
	    //JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "filename: "+badFile.getAbsolutePath());
	    if(badFile.exists()){
		boolean success = deleteRecursive(badFile);
		JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You were infected, fixing!");
		if(success)
		  JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Removal was successful, reboot your computer now, and change all your passwords!");
		else  
		  JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Tell moparisthebest on the forums removal didn't work, you are still infected!");
	    }else
	      JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You don't appear to be infected, great!");
	}
	catch(IOException ioexception) {
	    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Something went wrong, did you not click 'yes'?");
	}
    }

    public static boolean deleteRecursive(File path) throws FileNotFoundException{
	boolean ret = true;
	if (path.isDirectory()){
	    for (File f : path.listFiles()){
		ret = ret && deleteRecursive(f);
	    }
	}
	return ret && path.delete();
    }

    public void init()
    {
	main(null);
    }

    public void start()
    {

    }

    public void stop()
    {

    }

    public void destroy()
    {

    }
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:69, topic:410084”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=511352.msg3711389#msg3711389 date=1313369903]
Ok, the bad file that needs removed is in C:\windows\system32\install\ It is named svchost.exe, remove it right now and you will be fine.

Turns out it runs as firefox.exe if you have firefox installed, otherwise as svchost.exe.
[/quote]
I believe this is different for Windows 7.[/quote]inb4mitbmakesmore12yroldkidsmadbyfuckingoverthereos
